title: Particle motion - total distance from velocity

content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at any time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>5</mn><mi>t</mi><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C9A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. At t = 0, the particle is at position x = 1. What is the total distance traveled by the particle from t = 0 to t = 4?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
